item.description:
Time to take it up a notch! This hike takes us to Lake Solitude, White Ledge, and Mount Sunapee. There are great views from both White Ledge and the summit. And Lake Solitude is a beautifully pristine spot with crystal clear waters.

Total distance: About 6 miles
Elevation gain: About 1650 feet (cumulative)

Interactive trail map here: http://www.everytrail...

NOTE: Please be prepared for a walk which may feel strenuous at times! Bring proper clothing (no jeans, decent hiking boots, a jacket, a hat) and carry at least 2 quarts of water and some snacks!

DIRECTIONS: We will start and end at the Andrew Brook Trailhead, located in Newbury, New Hampshire.
* From the junction of Rt. 103 and Rt. 103A in Newbury, head east on Rt. 103 for 0.8 mile.
* Turn right onto Mountain Road.
* After 1.2 miles, the trailhead will be on the right just before Mountain Road crosses a bridge.
* There is limited parking here; do not block the woods road (trail). There is a sign for the trailhead but it isn't readily visible from the road. The trail can be hard to spot! It is on your right just before going over a small bridge over a brook. If you hit a dirt road you have gone too far.

ETA: Dog friendly, kid friendly (older kids!)

NOTE: Rain cancels! I will keep an eye on the weather!

This hike is cross-posted with New England Over 40 Hiking Group
